Back to Franz Schubert

Franz Schubert

Sonata in C major, D 613

1818

[Wikipedia] · [IMSLP page 1] · [IMSLP page 2]

Total duration: 16'

  • 1. Moderato
  • Adagio in E major, D 612
  • 2. Allegretto

The sonata is missing a slow movement. This is often taken to be the adagio in E major (D 612).

Recommended editions

  • Neue Schubert-Ausgabe (Bärenreiter) · VII/2/2 · BA 5541 · Klaviersonaten II · ed. Walburga Litschauer
  • Neue Schubert-Ausgabe (Bärenreiter) · VII/2/4 · BA 5525 · Klavierstücke I · ed. David Goldberger [D 612]
  • Associated Board · Complete Pianoforte Sonatas / Volume II · ed. Howard Ferguson [including D 612]
  • Henle · HN 150 · Klaviersonaten / Band III · ed. Paul Mies [with completion by Paul Badura-Skoda, including also D 612]
  • Henle · HN 151 · Klaviersonaten / Band III · ed. Paul Mies [with completion by Paul Badura-Skoda, including also D 612]
  • Wiener Urtext · UT 50221 · Sämtliche Klaviersonaten / Band 2 · ed. Martino Tirimo [with completion by Martino Tirimo, including also D 612]

1. Moderato

This movement is incomplete.

Duration: 6'

Difficulty: 3.5

Adagio in E major, D 612

Duration: 4' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5

2. Allegretto

This movement is incomplete.

Duration: 5' 30"

Difficulty: 4
